direction.raw_text: .  BOULEY RESTAURANT, NEW YORK - NIGHT Dim lighting, crowd buzz, a long line of the rich, the celebrated, the congenitally impatient.  Everyone in this queue holds a reservation at least an hour overdue.  Tourists can't even make the line.  PAN ahead to... ... the burnished dining room, the tables of power, the elegant service.  Covertly, many eyes are drawn to the one table receiving by far the most lavish service of all.  Captains hover, presenting delicacies, pouring wines, murmuring obsequiously to a guest whose person they screen from our view.  We can see, however... ... the honored guest's companion.  Ignored, bemused, across the table.  This is DIGGER DOWNES, 36, darkly attractive.  Kind eyes, an intellectual's mouth, Saville Row's most unobtrusive and conservative chalk-stripe suit.  He is gay, but you wouldn't guess it.  Loyal and wise and generous, and you might.  He watches with a quiet twinkle, as the Captains now step back, revealing to us... ... their most unlikely icon.  JULIANNE POTTER, almost 28, wears her favorite bulky sweater over a bunch of other stuff she pulled together in fifteen seconds. dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DOWN the white until we are...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the bride's perfect slippers.  HOLD.  And...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Begins to slowly PAN BACK UP the length of an exquisite gown.  We can tell from the organ, the nearby thrum of expectant voices, that we are nearing the moment.  We reach... ... Kimmy's hand.  Firmly clasping Walter's.  Keep PANNING, the bodice, the lace, her throat, and finally, we are CLOSE on... ... the face of the bride.  Now we understand the word radiant.  We also understand scared senseless.  Our perfect, unflappable Kimmy is in a trance of emotional overload where bliss and panic seamlessly blend. The organ's noddling stops.  Kimmy's eyes alerted, like a small animal bearing a predator approach her thicket.  Suddenly, the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  The Wedding March from Wagner's Lohengrin.  Here.  Comes. The bride.  And we SNAP TO...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Kim and Walter.  This is it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers) Left foot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ... Kim's POV, the chapel, every pew packed, every neck craning this way, the white satin carpet down the endless aisle to where... Michael waits.  Also in a zone of pseudo-consciousness.  From which he attempts a smile.  Not comforting.  Kim's POV WHIP PAN the groomsmen, the twins, LOCKING FOCUS on Julianne, standing strong and beautiful, a glow of her own in the daffodil dress.  She sends her little sister a WINK across the trackless miles of aisle.  You can do this, kid.  So... ... Kimmy does.  On her father's arm, she walks the gauntlet of the world's intrusive admiration.  One step at a time.  The most beautiful she will ever be.  She is dazzling the crowd and managing to not throw up at the same time. And she's there.  At his side.  She glances back to her maid of honor, just to make sure she's not working without a net.  So Julianne... ... CROSSES her eyes.  Which lets the kid smile and finally take a breath.  Have a little fun, huh? Kim nods, got it, turns to... The Minister.  Who stands before them with a calming presence. Thank God someone has done this before.  The crowd has hushed. The Minister's eyes are only for two.  His words are for all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ripple of laughter.  Gentle and fine.  They are setting in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A surprise.  A pleasant one.  The crowd adjust in its seats.  As Michael begins...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And on these words.  We SNAP to Julianne.  Share her interest in the bluntness, the simplicity, the unorthodoxy of this beginning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes.  She's listening.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Michael and Kimmy wrote these words.  She asked me to confide, mostly Michael.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So he gets to say them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do people get married anymore?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Why not live together amicably, with no sense of obligation beyond the moment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) As long as the sex is good.  As long as no one more interesting has wandered into view.  As long as the thousand conflicts of two individual wills remain comfortably compromised.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NING now.  Other faces.  Isabelle.  Proud to the bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter.  His eyes damp.  Against our expectation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe nods, as he hears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julianne once more.  No breath.  Rapt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes have clouded.  As if Michael is talking to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And suddenly, ALL the feeling rises in her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the tears come.  They come freely, unhidden, unnoticed.  As if they were needed. Michael now.  Looking at his bride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimmy smiles at him.  With love bigger than life itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is done.  There is a silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People LAUGH.  The Minister holds up a sheet of paper.  For the crowd to see.  Mostly paragraphs crossed out in red ink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bigger LAUGHTER.  The Minister waves this off, his little joke. Turns to the best man, pantomimes the ring.  As the hammered gold circle is handed to Michael, Julianne absently scratches her still- swollen finger.  Mandy taps Julianne on the arm, and produces... ... a matching ring.  Take it! Gives it to her.  So Julianne steps forward.  Places the second ring into Kimmy's waiting hand.  Their eyes meet, and hold throughout...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julianne CLEARS her throat.  Kimmy's heart flutters.  In the silence... Julianne's wonderful smile.  Just kidding. Michael reaches for Kim's hand, turns her gently to him.  Places his ring on her finger.  Holds her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She swallows.  Smiles a fleeting, beautiful smile.  Fumbles slightly, putting the ring on his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Staring in each other's eyes.  A moment so fragile, the Minister waits an extra beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Minister joins their right hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) And when one feels the urge to move on, to explore the new. No guilt, no disgrace, no promise broken.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) No agony of having dishonored a time.  When our hearts.  And the world were different.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Marriage is a lot to put up with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) The answer must be.  That there is some need basic to the human heart.  That embracing... the obligation of commitment... fulfills.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Some need to belong to one another in a way which rages against the notion... that all is impermanent. Against the notion of mortality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Our love is bigger.  And longer. Than life itself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what we want.  And marriage. Is what we do about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are fools in this.  Thank God Almighty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, that was good!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Michael and Kim also edited what they want me to say...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The idea was, we're only marrying once.  We have to remember it forever.  Let's keep to the good stuff. (squints at the sheet) You may kiss the bride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) If anyone here can show just cause why this man and woman should not be married, speak now.  Or forever hold your peace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kimberly.  I promise to love. And respect and comfort you. To hear your voice and your heart.  Until we are parted by death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Michael.  I promise to love and respect and comfort you.  To hear your voice and your heart. Until we are parted by death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For the record, you each agree to marry the other?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quickly) I do!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We haven't said much about God this evening, I know.  But He is here.  And He is happy.  To bless His wonderful children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: now on Julianne.  For the inevitable moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unnoticed by the world.  Her eyes are close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eyes open.  Wet, brave, ready for...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julianne watching.  As Michael does.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) In that Michael and Kimberly have given themselves to each other by solemn vows, and the exchanging of rings...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I pronounce them husband and wife. Those whom God has joined together, let no one put asunder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Now.  Kiss the bride.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: This is what all the preparation was for.  Tables, lights, balloons, the guests dancing on the hardwood floor, at the base of the gazebo. The bride and groom among them, relaxed and happy.  Two who are one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TO... ... the stage, the band playing.  Julianne conferring with the twins and the band leader, clear that she's giving the instructions. Then, she takes her glass of champagne to the microphone... ... KLUNKS it, for silence.  The band stops.  The dancers follow. All eyes are comfortably turned to the maid of honor.  She looks to the couple.  Just below her.  Then, to the crowd...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She raises her glass.  Everyone at the table does the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouts of support, a few whistles.  Silence.  She tells Michael...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She has to stop.  Swallows.  Because she will not let herself cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deep breath.  Looks in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hush.  SHARP applause.  From four hundred hands.  But not from his.  He is too moved.  Too understanding of what he has heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And with that the band begins.  The opening phrases of a song we have come to know.  Michael seems overwhelmed.  Julianne nods toward the gazebo... ... Michael takes his bride's hand, leads her up the stairs, into his arms, as the twins step to the microphone, and guests begin to applaud an unscheduled wedding dance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soft two-part harmony.  As perfect as the words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julianne can cry now.  Because she's tied with half the place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julianne begins to sing.  Unheard.  Unseen.  Even by the man she's singing to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The band keeps playing.  The dance goes on.  Two people lost in each other.  The way it's supposed to be.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a writer, too, not as good as Michael.  But I do steal from quality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is to my best friend.  On the occasion of his wedding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I have truly come to know your bride as my new sister. This is in her heart...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Understand.  I'll slip quietly away from the noisy crowd when I see the pale stars rising, blooming, over the oaks."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "I'll pursue solitary pathways through the pale twilit meadows, with only this one dream: You come too."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have a wedding gift. But this is on loan.  Until you two find your song...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) Someday, when I'm awfully low, And the world is cold, I will feel a glow just thinking of you, And the way you look tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) You're lovely.  With your smile so warm, And your cheeks so soft, There is nothing for me but to love you, Just the way you look tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) With each word, your tenderness grows, Tearing my fears apart... And the laugh that wrinkles your nose, Touches my foolish heart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) You're lovely, please don't ever change, Keep that breathless charm, Darling, please arrange it, cos I love you... Just the way you look tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bedlam.  Julianne caught in the middle of the throng.  A young couple, dressed for travel, appear at the top of the staircase. The SHOUT are deafening.  The bride has her bouquet... ... she spots Julianne far below.  THROWS it her way, Julianne reflexively GOES FOR IT... ... not a fucking chance.  The twins nearly TRAMPLE her in the stampede, Mandy WRESTING the prize from Sammy's grasp.  Everyone
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and then the couple is... ... FLYING down the stairs, RACING through the crowd with a protective phalanx of groomsmen bodyguards, heading for the door, for freedom... ... Julianne, trapped in the crush, loses sight of the couple, struggles against the flow, suddenly panicked by the certainty that she will never see him before... And then, he's THERE.  He has Julianne in his arms.  Holding her so tight.  An embrace so wonderful, so terrible, she could go mad from the confusion alone.  Against the din, he murmurs in her ear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sobs.  Holds him. Deep, deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And to her surprise...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To her greater surprise.  There are a few tears left, after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She just can't speak now.  So she doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fucking guy.  God, she loves him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just above a whisper...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And with the last of her strength...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A chuckle.  At the other end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear the CLICK.  She turns her back on the stars.  Shoulders straight.  Chin up. She walks from frame.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Wherever I go.  However far...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You win a few, you lose a few. Some get rained out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O., very softly) You have a good time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did what I came to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O., even softer) Good girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I was thinking.  Maybe you might visit us for awhile.  We've got the room made up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll think about it.  I'm okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Oh, you're more than okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If the sun comes up, I'll see you tomorrow, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I'll play those odds.  You have sweet dreams.
dialogue.name: dialogue
